title: How to copy and paste on a computer - Quora

response.answer_text: My guess is that since you have a Quora account, you can use the Internet to find your answer as well as anyone else, but here’s a link that should help you: How to Copy, Cut, and Paste on a Windows PC Quick Tip: Quora works best when answers demand expertise or strong opinions. Had you typed your question into your favorite search engine, you would have had the answer immediately instead of having to wait for someone to answer on Quora. Answers that can be easily looked up using a search engine or on a manufacturer’s web site add to the noise level on Quora and make it harder to use for everyone. BTW, there are so many questions on here whose answers are easily found with simple web searches that I’ve prepared this answer ahead of time in a text file (except for the specific link) and copied and pasted the whole thing.

Select whatever you want to copy and paste using the mouse. (Left click and move the mouse to select while holding the button down). then either right click on the selected item and choose “copy” in the drop down menu or press the <CTRL>+c keys at the same time, then move the cursor to wherever you want to paste it (Which does not have to be in the same window) and left click on that location, then either right click and choose “paste” from the menu or press <CTRL>+v to paste what you selected into that place.
